content:
I've just updated my Zulip 5.1 to 7.1. Did the steps of creating a new Postgres 14 and migrating the data. Changed to the new database.

Now after I start the server, it throws a 500 Internal Error, and the host uses a lot of CPU, bogging down the entire host.
Logs say Zulip migration succeeded
Latest logs are lots of PIDs spawned, entering running state. Any other settings needing changes for this upgrade?

Uhm, so did a restart of the server. No changes. Went out for coffee. Five minutes later, it logged in correctly - no changes in the log outputs

So, uhm. Problem solved I guess. Might try to allocate more memory to the host, since it's just has 2GB.
Jacob Havskov Lauritsen has marked this topic as resolved.
